731769f-a.title: Fires, accidents and tragedies - [Elevated railroad accident.]
731769f-a.text:
Fire, Accidents and Tragedies. An Elevated Railroad accident at Ninth Avenue and West 53rd Street. Twelve were killed and forty-eight injured. The photo-grapher is viewing eastward along the 53rd Street spur that joined the Sixth Avenue line to the Ninth Avenue. This was demolished in 1939.

September 11, 1905

710426f-a.text:
9th Ave at. 53rd
Construction Photo

731751f-a.title: Fires, accidents and tragedies - [Elevated railroad accident.]
731751f-a.text:
Fires, Accidents and Tragedies: An Elevated Railroad accident on Ntnth Avenue, at West 53rd Street. The photographer is viewing southeastward from a rooftop on the west side of the Avenue. Buildings shown on the east side of same, from 53rd (left) to 52nd
(right) Street's.
September 11, 1905
Gustave Scholer M. D.
Gift Thru New York Historical Society

731752f-a.title: Fires, accidents and tragedies - [Elevated railroad accident.]
731752f-a.text:
Elevated R.R. tragedy at Ninth Ave., and 53rd Street, Monday morning September 11th., 1905. Twelve persons were killed, and forty-eight injured. Fortunately for the early hour; or this might have proven one of
the major disasters in New York City's history.
SeDtember 11, 1905.
Gustav Scholer, N.D.
766  NEG ~:.
